content: hdc2tog x 2 half_double_crochet into remaining 24 sts turn 50sts row 16 ch1 work half_double_crochet into next 23 sts hdc2tog x 2 half_double_crochet into remaining 23 sts turn 48sts row 17 ch1 work half_double_crochet into next 22 sts hdc2tog x 2 half_double_crochet into remaining 22 sts turn 46sts row 18 ch1 work half_double_crochet into next 21 sts hdc2tog x 2 half_double_crochet into remaining 21 sts turn 44sts row 19 ch1 work half_double_crochet into next 20 sts hdc2tog x 2 half_double_crochet into remaining 20 sts turn 42sts row 20 ch1 work half_double_crochet into next 19 sts hdc2tog x 2 half_double_crochet into remaining 19 sts turn 40sts row 21 ch1 work half_double_crochet into next 18 sts hdc2tog x 2 half_double_crochet into remaining 18 sts turn 38sts row 22 ch1 work half_double_crochet into next 17 sts hdc2tog x 2 half_double_crochet into remaining 17 sts turn 36sts row 23 ch1 work half_double_crochet into next 10 sts hdc2tog x 8 half_double_crochet into remaining 10 sts turn 28sts fasten_off leaving a long tail for sewing the top up turn hood inside out and sew the gap shut through whip stitching between the two loops either side as shown turn the hood back the right way around you should have a fairly seamless finish trim worked around the front of the jacket up around the hood row 1 attach yarn to lower right front of jacket and working from left to right around the jacket front and the hood ch1 not a st from now on then single_crochet evenly around turn the amount will depend on your gauge mine was 76sts but be careful not to work too many or two few as the front of the jacket will become misshapen row 2 ch1 single_crochet in each st across working button holes where you want them by ch2 and skipping two sts turn i put two on the right hand side row 3 ch1 single_crochet around working 2sc into the ch2 button spaces turn slip_stitch loosely around to give a neat finish attach buttons and you re done
